name: test_callgraph_alias_resolution
docstring: Call graph resolution tests for import alias heuristics.

name: test_callgraph_resolves_import_alias
docstring:
Call graph builder should resolve calls made through an import alias.

    Raises
    ------
    AssertionError
        If alias-based resolution fails to return the expected GOID.

name: _write_repo_files
docstring:
Create minimal caller/callee modules for alias resolution.

    Returns
    -------
    tuple[Path, Path]
        Paths to the callee and caller Python files.

name: test_tests_analytics_unit
docstring: Unit tests for analytics.tests_analytics helpers.

name: test_backfill_test_goids_updates_catalog
docstring: Ensure test_catalog entries receive GOIDs and URNs when matched to GOIDs.

name: test_edges_for_file_uses_test_meta
docstring: _edges_for_file should carry through mapped test GOIDs/URNs and coverage ratios.

name: test_compute_test_coverage_edges_with_fake_coverage
docstring: compute_test_coverage_edges should join coverage contexts with test GOIDs.

name: test_pipeline_smoke
docstring: Smoke test that runs the full pipeline target export_docs on a tiny repo.

name: test_pipeline_export_docs_smoke
docstring:
Build a minimal repo, run export_docs, and verify GOID export exists.

    Raises
    ------
    RuntimeError
        If the pipeline run fails or GOID export is missing.

name: __init__
docstring: Test suite package for CodeIntel.

name: test_export_smoke
docstring: Smoke test for exporting datasets to Document Output.

name: test_export_all_writes_expected_files
docstring:
Seed a minimal DB and verify Parquet/JSONL exports are produced.

    This ensures the export mappings are usable end-to-end.

    Raises
    ------
    AssertionError
        If any expected export is missing after running both exporters.

name: __init__
docstring: Test package for docs export parity and smoke tests.

name: test_export_parity
docstring: Parity checks for Document Output dataset mappings.

name: test_export_mappings_cover_required_tables
docstring:
Ensure export mappings include core, graph, analytics tables per architecture.

    This acts as a guardrail if new tables are added without updating exports.

    Raises
    ------
    AssertionError
        If either Parquet or JSONL mappings omit required tables.

name: test_fastapi_endpoints
docstring: Integration smoke tests for FastAPI endpoints against a seeded DuckDB.

name: _build_app
docstring:
Construct a FastAPI app bound to the provided DuckDB connection.

    Returns
    -------
    FastAPI
        Configured application using the supplied backend.

name: test_fastapi_endpoints_smoke
docstring: Seed a DuckDB and verify key FastAPI endpoints return data.

name: _json_or_fail
docstring:
Parse JSON payload or fail with a helpful message.

    Returns
    -------
    dict[str, object] | list[object]
        Parsed JSON payload when status is 200.

name: _expect_dict
docstring:
Ensure payload is a dict or fail.

    Returns
    -------
    dict[str, object]
        Validated JSON object payload.

name: test_fastapi
docstring: FastAPI route coverage for CodeIntel API surface.

name: db_path
docstring:
Provide a temporary DuckDB file path.

    Returns
    -------
    Path
        Filesystem path for the temporary database.

name: con
docstring:
Create an in-memory DuckDB with minimal tables for API tests.

    Yields
    ------
    duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Seeded connection that is cleaned up after each test.

name: api_config
docstring:
Build an ApiAppConfig pinned to the temporary DuckDB.

    Returns
    -------
    ApiAppConfig
        Application configuration for the test app.

name: backend
docstring:
Provide a DuckDBBackend bound to the seeded connection.

    Returns
    -------
    DuckDBBackend
        Backend backed by the temporary DuckDB.

name: app
docstring:
Construct a FastAPI app using injected configuration and backend.

    Returns
    -------
    FastAPI
        Application instance under test.

name: client
docstring:
Yield a TestClient that runs startup/shutdown events.

    Yields
    ------
    TestClient
        HTTP client for exercising the API.

name: test_function_summary_success
docstring: Return function summary when URN is present.

name: test_function_summary_not_found
docstring: Return Problem Details when the function does not exist.

name: test_tests_for_function_validation
docstring: Reject missing identifiers when requesting tests for a function.

name: test_tests_for_function_success
docstring: Return test rows for a valid function.

name: test_dataset_rows_unknown_dataset
docstring: Return a Problem Detail for unknown dataset names.

name: test_dataset_rows_limit_clamped
docstring: Clamp dataset reads that exceed configured limits with messaging.

name: test_dataset_rows_success
docstring: Return dataset rows for configured datasets.

name: __init__
docstring: Test package for FastAPI server components.

name: test_prefect_flow_smoke
docstring: Smoke test to ensure Prefect flow scaffolding imports and runs no-op path.

name: test_prefect_flow_imports
docstring: Prefect flow can be imported without side effects.

name: test_prefect_flow_minimal
docstring:
Run the flow with empty inputs to ensure it executes without raising.

    This is a lightweight guardrail; full data population is covered elsewhere.

name: conftest
docstring: Prefect test fixtures for quiet, graceful orchestration runs.

name: _quiet_prefect_logging
docstring: Suppress Prefect/Rich console logging to avoid noisy teardown errors.

name: prefect_quiet_env
docstring:
Run Prefect flows against the ephemeral test harness with minimal logging.

    The harness starts a temporary API/database and ensures clean shutdown,
    preventing teardown errors or CRASHED states when the process exits.

name: __init__
docstring: Test package for Prefect orchestration scaffolding.

name: test_backend
docstring: Backend behavior tests for MCP components.

name: con
docstring:
Create an in-memory DuckDB connection with minimal MCP tables.

    Returns
    -------
    duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Connection seeded with fixture tables for MCP backend tests.

name: backend
docstring:
Backend configured against the in-memory DuckDB.

    Returns
    -------
    DuckDBBackend
        Backend under test.

name: test_get_function_summary
docstring: Function summary resolves when URN is provided.

name: test_get_function_summary_invalid
docstring: Missing identifiers yields an MCP error.

name: test_callgraph_direction_validation
docstring: Direction validation rejects unsupported values.

name: test_get_tests_for_function
docstring: Tests for function returns seeded test rows.

name: test_get_tests_for_function_invalid
docstring: Missing identifiers for tests raises MCP error.

name: test_read_dataset_rows_unknown
docstring: Unknown dataset names raise MCP errors.

name: test_dataset_rows_clamping
docstring: Limits/offsets clamp with messages instead of raising.

name: test_tests_for_function_not_found
docstring: Missing test edges returns message instead of raising.

name: __init__
docstring: Test package for MCP components.

name: types
docstring: Shared typed protocols and TypedDicts to reduce use of ``Any``.

name: PytestCallEntry
docstring: Subset of pytest-json-report call data.

name: PytestTestEntry
docstring: Shape of a pytest-json-report test object.

name: PyreflyError
docstring: Shape of a pyrefly JSON diagnostic.

name: ScipOccurrence
docstring: Occurrence entry within a SCIP JSON document.

name: ScipDocument
docstring: SCIP JSON document emitted by scip-python.

name: HasModelDump
docstring: Protocol for Pydantic models used in MCP responses.

name: model_dump
docstring: Return a dictionary representation.

name: __init__
docstring: CodeIntel package exposing ingestion, analytics, and orchestration tooling for CLI and MCP.

name: cfg_builder
docstring: Build minimal control-flow and data-flow graph placeholders for functions.

name: CFGBuilderConfig
docstring:
Configuration for deriving control-flow/data-flow graph placeholders.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo : str
        Repository slug being analyzed.
    commit : str
        Commit SHA corresponding to the snapshot.

name: build_cfg_and_dfg
docstring:
Emit minimal CFG/DFG scaffolding for each function GOID.

    Extended Summary
    ----------------
    For every function or method GOID, the builder writes a single `body`
    block covering the function span and leaves the edge tables empty. This
    provides a schema-compatible placeholder that downstream tools can enrich
    with precise control/data flow without blocking the rest of the pipeline.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Connection to a DuckDB database with GOID metadata available.
    cfg : CFGBuilderConfig
        Repository context identifying which snapshot to process.

name: import_graph
docstring: Construct module-level import graphs from LibCST parsing.

name: ImportGraphConfig
docstring:
Configuration for constructing the import graph of a repo snapshot.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo : str
        Repository slug for tagging rows.
    commit : str
        Commit SHA corresponding to the snapshot.
    repo_root : Path
        Root directory where source files are located.

name: _ImportCollector
docstring:
Collects module imports for a single source module.

    This is a best-effort builder; relative imports are resolved
    conservatively to the current module's package.

name: _tarjan_scc
docstring:
Compute strongly connected components using Tarjan's algorithm.

    Parameters
    ----------
    graph : dict[str, set[str]]
        Adjacency list mapping modules to their imported modules.

    Returns
    -------
    dict[str, int]
        Mapping of module name to component identifier.

name: build_import_graph
docstring:
Populate `graph.import_graph_edges` from LibCST import analysis.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Connection to the DuckDB instance seeded with `core.modules`.
    cfg : ImportGraphConfig
        Repository context and filesystem root.

    Notes
    -----
    The collector resolves relative imports conservatively to the current
    package. Strongly connected components are computed to identify cycles.

name: symbol_uses
docstring: Build symbol definition-to-use edges from SCIP JSON exports.

name: SymbolUsesConfig
docstring:
Configuration for deriving symbol use edges.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo_root : Path
        Root of the repository containing source files.
    scip_json_path : Path
        Path to the `index.scip.json` document produced by scip-python.

name: build_symbol_use_edges
docstring:
Populate graph.symbol_use_edges from `index.scip.json`.

    The SCIP JSON is expected to be an array of documents:
      { "relative_path": str, "occurrences": [...], "symbols": [...] }

    We treat occurrences with symbol_roles bit 1 as definitions,
    and bit 2 as references, producing edges def_path -> use_path.

name: callgraph_builder
docstring: Build call graph nodes and edges from GOIDs and LibCST traversal.

name: CallGraphConfig
docstring:
Configuration for constructing a call graph for a repo snapshot.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo : str
        Repository slug for tagging rows.
    commit : str
        Commit SHA corresponding to the analyzed snapshot.
    repo_root : Path
        Root directory containing the repository source files.

name: FunctionRow
docstring: Lightweight representation of a function GOID row.

name: _FileCallGraphVisitor
docstring:
LibCST visitor that records call edges within a single file.

    The visitor tracks the current function GOID while walking the CST and
    appends caller/callee edges with callsite locations and resolution hints.

name: resolve_callee
docstring:
Resolve callee GOID via simple name and attribute heuristics.

        Returns
        -------
        tuple[int | None, str, float]
            (GOID, resolved_via, confidence) tuple.

name: _ImportAliasCollector
docstring: Collect import and from-import aliases for a module.

name: build_call_graph
docstring:
Populate call graph nodes and edges for a repository snapshot.

    Extended Summary
    ----------------
    The builder seeds `graph.call_graph_nodes` from GOID metadata and then
    traverses each Python file with LibCST to detect call expressions. Edges
    are deduplicated by caller, callee, and callsite coordinates before being
    persisted to `graph.call_graph_edges`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        DuckDB connection with GOID tables and graph schemas present.
    cfg : CallGraphConfig
        Repository metadata and filesystem root used to locate source files.

name: collect_edges_for_testing
docstring:
Collect call graph edges for tests without touching DuckDB state.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo_root : Path
        Filesystem root for the repository.
    func_rows : list[FunctionRow]
        Function metadata rows to seed the collector.

    Returns
    -------
    list[tuple]
        Call edge tuples mirroring `_collect_edges` output.

name: resolve_callee_for_testing
docstring:
Resolve a callee GOID for tests without traversing the full CST.

    Parameters
    ----------
    callee_name : str
        Base callee name extracted from the call expression.
    attr_chain : list[str]
        Attribute chain for the callee (e.g., ["pkg", "module", "func"]).
    callee_by_name : dict[str, int]
        Local mapping from names to GOIDs within the file.
    global_callee_by_name : dict[str, int]
        Repository-wide mapping used when a local match is missing.
    import_aliases : dict[str, str]
        Import aliases collected for the file being analyzed.

    Returns
    -------
    tuple[int | None, str, float]
        GOID (or None if unresolved), resolution source, and confidence score.

name: goid_builder
docstring: Build GOIDs and crosswalk entries from AST nodes.

name: GoidBuilderConfig
docstring: Configuration for building GOIDs.

name: GoidDescriptor
docstring: Descriptor for a single code entity.

name: _relpath_to_module
docstring:
Convert a repository-relative path to a dotted module path.

    Parameters
    ----------
    path:
        Repository-relative path to a Python file.

    Returns
    -------
    str
        Dotted module path derived from the relative path.

name: _compute_goid
docstring:
Compute a stable 128-bit GOID integer from an entity descriptor.

    Parameters
    ----------
    descriptor:
        Metadata describing the code entity.

    Returns
    -------
    int
        Stable 128-bit integer representation of the GOID.

name: _build_urn
docstring:
Build a GOID URN that matches the README format.

    Parameters
    ----------
    descriptor:
        Metadata describing the code entity.

    Returns
    -------
    str
        GOID URN encoding repo, path, kind, and span.

name: build_goids
docstring:
Populate core.goids and core.goid_crosswalk from core.ast_nodes.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con:
        DuckDB connection to populate.
    cfg:
        Configuration identifying the repo and commit to hash.

name: __init__
docstring: Graph builders that derive call graphs, control-flow graphs, import graphs, and symbol uses.

name: export_parquet
docstring: Parquet exporters for the CodeIntel metadata warehouse.

name: export_parquet_for_table
docstring:
Export a single DuckDB table to Parquet.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Live DuckDB connection.
    table_name : str
        Fully qualified table name (schema.table) to export.
    output_path : Path
        Destination path for the Parquet file.

    Notes
    -----
    Uses `COPY (SELECT * FROM <table>) TO <path> (FORMAT PARQUET)`. The export
    assumes the database already scopes data to a single repo/commit. Table
    names are validated against the known dataset mapping to avoid unsafe SQL.

    Raises
    ------
    ValueError
        If the requested table is not in the allowed export mapping.

name: export_all_parquet
docstring:
Export all known datasets to Parquet files under `Document Output/`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con:
        DuckDB connection with all tables populated.
    document_output_dir:
        Path to the `Document Output/` directory (will be created
        if it does not exist).

name: export_jsonl
docstring: JSON/JSONL exporters for the CodeIntel metadata warehouse.

name: export_jsonl_for_table
docstring:
Export a single DuckDB table to JSONL.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Live DuckDB connection.
    table_name : str
        Fully qualified table name (schema.table) to export.
    output_path : Path
        Destination path for the JSONL file.

    Notes
    -----
    Uses `COPY (SELECT * FROM <table>) TO <path> (FORMAT JSON, ARRAY FALSE)`
    so each row is serialized as a single JSON object per line. Table names are
    validated against the known dataset mapping to avoid unsafe SQL injection.

    Raises
    ------
    ValueError
        If the requested table is not in the allowed export mapping.

name: export_all_jsonl
docstring:
Export all configured datasets to JSONL files under `Document Output/`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        DuckDB connection seeded with CodeIntel schemas.
    document_output_dir : Path
        Target directory where JSONL artifacts are written.

    Returns
    -------
    list[Path]
        Paths to every JSON/JSONL file written, including the manifest.

name: export_repo_map_json
docstring:
Export `core.repo_map` to a `repo_map.json` file.

    Extended Summary
    ----------------
    The payload mirrors the structure described in README_METADATA, including
    repo identifiers, module mapping, overlays, and a generation timestamp:

      {
        "repo": "...",
        "commit": "...",
        "modules": { "pkg.mod": "path/to/file.py", ... },
        "overlays": {...},
        "generated_at": "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z"
      } :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

    Returns
    -------
    Path | None
        Path to the written `repo_map.json`, or None when no repo_map rows
        are available in the database.

name: __init__
docstring: Doc export utilities for emitting CodeIntel analytics as JSONL or Parquet artifacts.

name: ast_cst_extract
docstring: Extract AST/CST structures and metrics into DuckDB tables.

name: AstRow
docstring:
Flattened AST node record emitted for each module.

    Attributes mirror the `core.ast_nodes` schema, capturing node identity,
    location, decorators, and parent relationships.

name: AstDescriptor
docstring: Descriptor capturing logical AST identity for a node.

name: CstRow
docstring:
Flattened CST node record used to persist LibCST metadata.

    Captures node identity, span coordinates, text preview, parent kinds, and
    qualified names derived during traversal.

name: FileMetrics
docstring:
Aggregated metrics describing a single Python file's structure.

    Includes counts of nodes, functions, and classes alongside depth and
    heuristic complexity information.

name: avg_depth
docstring: Average syntax tree depth for visited nodes.

name: max_depth
docstring: Maximum syntax tree depth encountered.

name: AstCstVisitor
docstring:
Collect AST rows, CST rows, and structural metrics for a module traversal.

    The visitor increments complexity counters, tracks scope, and captures
    position metadata for every LibCST node it encounters.

name: __init__
docstring: Initialize visitor state for the target module.

name: on_visit
docstring:
Track traversal depth, record CST metadata, and handle AST bookkeeping.

        Returns
        -------
        bool
            True to continue traversal into children.

name: on_leave
docstring: Pop traversal depth and parent stacks after visiting a node.

name: _record_module
docstring: Record the module root and reset traversal scope.

name: _record_class
docstring: Record class definitions and push them onto the scope stack.

name: _record_function
docstring: Record function or async function AST rows and push scope.

name: _current_qualname
docstring:
Return the current fully qualified name for the traversal scope.

        Returns
        -------
        str
            Fully qualified name including nested scopes.

name: _record_ast_row
docstring: Append an AstRow describing the current node and its position.

name: _record_cst_row
docstring: Append a CstRow capturing span, parents, and preview text.

name: _decorator_to_str
docstring:
Render a decorator expression into a dotted string representation.

        Returns
        -------
        str
            Decorator reference rendered as a dotted path.

name: _extract_docstring_from_module
docstring:
Return the module-level docstring, if present.

        Returns
        -------
        str | None
            Evaluated docstring text or None when absent.

name: _extract_docstring_from_suite
docstring:
Extract a docstring from an indented or simple suite.

        Returns
        -------
        str | None
            Evaluated docstring text or None when absent.

name: _extract_docstring_from_body
docstring:
Mirror ast.get_docstring semantics for the first statement in a body.

        Returns
        -------
        str | None
            Evaluated docstring text or None when absent.

name: _load_module_map
docstring:
Return a mapping of relative file paths to module names from core.modules.

    Returns
    -------
    dict[str, str]
        Mapping of relative paths to module import names for the repo snapshot.

name: ingest_ast_and_cst
docstring:
Parse modules listed in core.modules and populate AST/CST tables.

    For each module in `core.modules` for the given repo/commit, the function
    reads the source file with LibCST and emits:

      - core.ast_nodes
      - core.ast_metrics
      - core.cst_nodes

name: docstrings_ingest
docstring: Extract structured docstrings with Griffe and persist to DuckDB.

name: DocstringConfig
docstring: Configuration for docstring ingestion.

name: DocstringProto
docstring: Lightweight view of a griffe docstring.

name: DocLocationProto
docstring: Subset of griffe location metadata.

name: DocObject
docstring: Protocol capturing the griffe object interface we rely on.

name: LoaderProto
docstring: Protocol for the griffe loader we call.

name: load_file
docstring: Load a Python file into a griffe object tree.

name: GriffeHandles
docstring: Loaded griffe classes and loader instance.

name: DocstringContext
docstring: Shared ingestion context for building docstring rows.

name: ingest_docstrings
docstring:
Extract docstrings for all Python modules in core.modules and persist them.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Active DuckDB connection.
    cfg : DocstringConfig
        Repository context for this ingestion run.

name: _load_griffe
docstring:
Attempt to import griffe and return callable handles.

    Returns
    -------
    GriffeHandles | None
        Loaded classes and loader instance, or None if griffe is missing.

name: repo_scan
docstring: Scan repository sources into core.modules and related metadata tables.

name: ModuleRow
docstring: Representation of a single discovered module.

name: TagEntry
docstring: Classification rules applied to repository paths.

name: relpath_to_module
docstring:
Convert a repository-relative Python path to a dotted module name.

    Parameters
    ----------
    rel_path:
        Repo-relative path to a .py file.

    Returns
    -------
    str
        Dotted module path.

name: ingest_repo
docstring:
Scan the repository and populate module metadata tables.

      - core.modules
      - core.repo_map
      - analytics.tags_index

    Assumes the DuckDB schemas & tables have already been created.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con:
        DuckDB connection.
    repo_root:
        Filesystem path to the repo root.
    repo:
        Repo identifier slug.
    commit:
        Commit SHA for this analysis run.
    tags_index_path:
        Optional explicit path to tags_index.yaml. Defaults to
        `<repo_root>/tags_index.yaml`.

name: config_ingest
docstring: Ingest configuration keypaths into analytics.config_values.

name: _flatten_config
docstring:
Flatten a nested dict or list into dotted keypaths.

    Examples
    --------
    >>> _flatten_config({"service": {"database": {"host": "db"}}})
    [('service.database.host', 'db')]
    >>> _flatten_config(["a", {"b": 2}])
    [('0', 'a'), ('1.b', 2)]

    Parameters
    ----------
    obj :
        Arbitrary nested mapping or sequence parsed from a config file.
    prefix : str, optional
        Prefix applied to generated keypaths; used during recursion.

    Returns
    -------
    list of tuple[str, object]
        Flattened keypaths paired with their leaf values.

name: ingest_config_values
docstring:
Populate analytics.config_values from configuration files.

    For each config file:
      - detect format
      - parse into a dict-like structure
      - flatten into keypaths
      - insert rows with empty reference_paths / reference_modules

    A later analytics step can fill reference_paths/modules by scanning
    AST/uses.

name: typing_ingest
docstring: Ingest typedness ratios and static diagnostics for Python files.

name: AnnotationInfo
docstring:
Ratio and count statistics summarizing annotations in a file.

    Parameters
    ----------
    params_ratio : float
        Fraction of parameters (excluding self/cls) with annotations.
    returns_ratio : float
        Fraction of functions with return annotations.
    untyped_defs : int
        Count of function definitions missing full annotations.

name: _run_pyrefly
docstring:
Run pyrefly and aggregate error counts per file.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo_root : Path
        Root directory to scan with pyrefly.

    Returns
    -------
    dict[str, int]
        Mapping from repository-relative paths to error counts.

name: ingest_typing_signals
docstring:
Populate per-file typedness and static diagnostics.

      - analytics.typedness
      - analytics.static_diagnostics

    Notes
    -----
      * Pyrefly drives static error counts; annotation_ratio is computed from Python AST
        (params & returns).

name: coverage_ingest
docstring: Ingest coverage.py results into `analytics.coverage_lines`.

name: CoverageInsertContext
docstring: Shared context for inserting coverage rows.

name: CoverageFileInfo
docstring: Resolved coverage file paths used during ingestion.

name: ingest_coverage_lines
docstring:
Read a `.coverage` database and populate `analytics.coverage_lines`.

    The ingestion uses the `coverage.py` API and assumes data was collected
    with `dynamic_context = test_function` or similar so context_count can be
    computed. Rows contain repo, commit, path, line number, execution flags,
    hit counts, and created_at timestamps.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Connection to the DuckDB database.
    repo_root : Path
        Root of the repository whose coverage is being ingested.
    repo : str
        Repository slug.
    commit : str
        Commit SHA for the coverage snapshot.
    coverage_file : Path, optional
        Path to the `.coverage` database. Defaults to `<repo_root>/.coverage`.

name: scip_ingest
docstring: Run SCIP indexing and register outputs for downstream analytics.

name: ScipIngestConfig
docstring: Configuration for SCIP ingestion.

name: ingest_scip
docstring:
Run scip-python + scip print, register view, and backfill SCIP symbols.

    Returns
    -------
    Path | None
        Path to index.scip.json on success, otherwise None.

    Raises
    ------
    RuntimeError
        If SCIP binaries are unavailable or indexing/print fails.

name: _update_scip_symbols
docstring: Populate core.goid_crosswalk.scip_symbol by matching SCIP definitions to GOIDs.

name: tests_ingest
docstring: Ingest pytest JSON reports into `analytics.test_catalog`.

name: _nodeid_to_path_and_qualname
docstring:
Split a pytest nodeid into a path and qualified test name.

    The input looks like `tests/test_app.py::TestFoo::test_bar[param]` and the
    result is a `(rel_path, qualname)` tuple.

    Parameters
    ----------
    nodeid : str
        Pytest node identifier to split.

    Returns
    -------
    tuple[str, str | None]
        Relative path and qualified name (None when missing).

name: TestCatalogRow

name: models

Configuration models used by the CodeIntel CLI and pipeline steps.

These Pydantic models normalize repository identity, filesystem layout, and tool
paths so downstream ingestion and analytics stages can rely on consistent
settings.

name: RepoConfig
PathsConfig
docstring:
Filesystem layout for a single CodeIntel run.

      repo_root/
        src/
        Document Output/
        build/
          db/codeintel.duckdb

Expand user home markers for any path-like CLI inputs.

Directory where SCIP index artifacts are stored.

name: ToolsConfig

External tool configuration used by ingestion and analytics pipelines.

docstring:
Top-level configuration used by the CLI.

            repo=RepoConfig(repo="myrepo", commit="deadbeef"),
            paths=PathsConfig(repo_root=".", ...),
        )

name: from_cli_args
docstring:
Build a CodeIntelConfig from pre-parsed CLI models.

        paths_cfg : PathsConfig

        tools_cfg : ToolsConfig | None
            Optional external tool configuration; defaults to ToolsConfig().
        default_targets : list[str] | None

        Returns

name: document_output_dir

Directory where documentation-ready artifacts are written.

risk factors, etc.).

name: __init__
docstring: Pipeline orchestration primitives that chain ingestion, analytics, and graph builders.

name: __init__
docstring: Typing and protocol stubs that mirror CodeIntel public APIs for static analysis.

name: ast_metrics
docstring:
Compute AST-derived metrics and git churn hotspots for a repository snapshot.

The routines here populate DuckDB analytics tables by combining LibCST-derived
complexity estimates with lightweight git log statistics. Hotspot scores help
prioritize files that change frequently and carry structural complexity.

name: HotspotsConfig
docstring:
Configuration describing the repository snapshot used to compute hotspots.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo : str
        Repository name used for tagging analytics rows.
    commit : str
        Commit SHA corresponding to the ingestion batch.
    repo_root : Path
        Filesystem root where the repository working tree is located.
    max_commits : int, optional
        Maximum number of commits to scan from git history when deriving churn
        metrics. Defaults to 2000 to keep the log query fast.

name: FileChurn
docstring: Aggregated churn details for a single file.

name: to_summary
docstring:
Summarize churn counts for persistence.

        Returns
        -------
        dict[str, int]
            Counts keyed by commit/author/lines added/deleted.

name: _collect_git_file_stats
docstring:
Collect per-file churn statistics from `git log --numstat`.

    The routine shells out to git to gather commit counts, author counts, and
    added/deleted line totals for every path touched within the configured
    commit window. It tolerates missing git binaries by returning an empty
    mapping so callers can still emit AST-only metrics.

    Parameters
    ----------
    cfg : HotspotsConfig
        Repository context including the root directory and log depth limit.

    Returns
    -------
    dict[str, dict]
        Mapping of repository-relative paths to churn statistics. Each value
        includes commit_count, author_count, lines_added, and lines_deleted.

    Notes
    -----
    The function logs git failures but never raises, enabling analytics
    pipelines to proceed even in shallow or detached checkouts. Complexity is
    proportional to the number of git log entries inspected.

name: build_hotspots
docstring:
Populate `analytics.hotspots` by merging AST complexity with git churn.

    Extended Summary
    ----------------
    The query walks all files present in `core.ast_metrics`, enriches them with
    git commit and author counts, and derives a composite hotspot score. Scores
    emphasize frequently modified files with higher structural complexity, which
    helps prioritize review and testing effort.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        DuckDB connection with `core.ast_metrics` and `analytics.hotspots`
        tables already created.
    cfg : HotspotsConfig
        Repository metadata and git scan configuration used to scope the build.

    Notes
    -----
    - Time complexity is O(n) over the number of files in `core.ast_metrics`
      plus the configured git log window.
    - The function is idempotent per repo/commit: it truncates
      `analytics.hotspots` before inserting new rows.
    - Git log failures degrade gracefully by treating churn metrics as zeros.

    Examples
    --------
    >>> import duckdb
    >>> from pathlib import Path
    >>> con = duckdb.connect(":memory:")
    >>> con.execute("CREATE SCHEMA core")
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute("CREATE SCHEMA analytics")
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute("CREATE TABLE core.ast_metrics(rel_path VARCHAR, complexity DOUBLE)")
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute(
    ...     "CREATE TABLE analytics.hotspots(rel_path VARCHAR, commit_count INTEGER,"
    ...     " author_count INTEGER, lines_added INTEGER, lines_deleted INTEGER,"
    ...     " complexity DOUBLE, score DOUBLE)"
    ... )
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute("INSERT INTO core.ast_metrics VALUES ('sample.py', 3.0)")
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> cfg = HotspotsConfig(
    ...     repo="demo",
    ...     commit="abc123",
    ...     repo_root=Path("."),
    ...     max_commits=0,
    ... )
    >>> build_hotspots(con, cfg)  # consumes empty git stats when max_commits=0
    >>> con.execute("SELECT rel_path, score FROM analytics.hotspots").fetchall()
    [('sample.py', 0.17328679513998632)]

name: functions
docstring:
Derive per-function complexity metrics and type hints from Python source files.

This module reads GOID metadata, walks Python ASTs to compute structural metrics,
and emits analytics tables used by downstream scoring and documentation tools.

name: FunctionMeta
docstring: Minimal metadata for a function GOID.

name: ParamStats
docstring: Parameter and return annotation statistics for a function.

name: TypednessFlags
docstring: Typedness summary flags derived from annotations.

name: ProcessContext
docstring: Shared context for building analytics rows.

name: FunctionDerived
docstring: Derived structural flags for a function body.

name: FunctionAnalyticsConfig
docstring:
Configuration describing the repository snapshot used for function analytics.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo : str
        Repository identifier stored alongside analytics rows.
    commit : str
        Commit SHA of the snapshot being analyzed.
    repo_root : Path
        Filesystem path to the repository root where source files are read.

name: GoidRow
docstring: Row structure for function GOIDs pulled from DuckDB.

name: _FunctionStats
docstring:
Collect per-function structural metrics while walking an AST node.

    The visitor records cyclomatic complexity, nesting depth, and counts of
    return, yield, and raise statements for the function under inspection.

name: compute_function_metrics_and_types
docstring:
Populate function metrics and type coverage tables from GOID spans.

    Extended Summary
    ----------------
    For each function or method GOID in `core.goids`, the routine parses the
    corresponding Python file, derives structural metrics (LOC, complexity,
    nesting depth), and captures annotation coverage for parameters and return
    values. Outputs are written to `analytics.function_metrics` and
    `analytics.function_types`, enabling downstream risk scoring and typedness
    reporting.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Connection with `core.goids`, `analytics.function_metrics`, and
        `analytics.function_types` tables available.
    cfg : FunctionAnalyticsConfig
        Repository metadata and file-system root used to locate source files.

    Notes
    -----
    - The function reads each source file once and reuses the parsed AST for
      all contained GOIDs.
    - It skips functions whose source files are missing or invalid, logging
      context so pipeline failures can be triaged quickly.

name: coverage_analytics
docstring:
Aggregate line-level coverage data into function-level coverage statistics.

The utilities here join GOIDs with coverage line spans to compute per-function
execution ratios, which downstream risk scoring relies on.

name: CoverageAnalyticsConfig
compute_coverage_functions
docstring:
Populate `analytics.coverage_functions` by aggregating line coverage per GOID.

    Extended Summary
    ----------------
    The query joins function and method GOIDs with `analytics.coverage_lines`
    records to compute executable line counts, covered lines, and derived ratios.
    Results mirror the `coverage_functions` schema from `README_METADATA` so
    downstream risk scoring and reporting can reason about test completeness.

    Parameters
    ----------
    con : duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Connection with `core.goids` and `analytics.coverage_lines` populated.
    cfg : CoverageAnalyticsConfig
        Repository and commit identifiers that scope the aggregation.

    Notes
    -----
    - Existing rows for the same repo/commit are deleted before insertion,
      making the operation idempotent for a given snapshot.
    - Time complexity is proportional to the number of functions and covered
      lines for the specified commit.

    Examples
    --------
    >>> import duckdb
    >>> con = duckdb.connect(":memory:")
    >>> con.execute("CREATE SCHEMA core")
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute("CREATE SCHEMA analytics")
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute(
    ...     "CREATE TABLE core.goids(urn VARCHAR, repo VARCHAR, commit VARCHAR,"
    ...     " rel_path VARCHAR, language VARCHAR, kind VARCHAR, qualname VARCHAR,"
    ...     " goid_h128 VARCHAR, start_line INTEGER, end_line INTEGER)"
    ... )
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute(
    ...     "CREATE TABLE analytics.coverage_lines(repo VARCHAR, commit VARCHAR,"
    ...     " rel_path VARCHAR, line INTEGER, is_executable BOOLEAN, is_covered BOOLEAN)"
    ... )
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute(
    ...     "CREATE TABLE analytics.coverage_functions("
    ...     "function_goid_h128 VARCHAR, urn VARCHAR, repo VARCHAR, commit VARCHAR,"
    ...     " rel_path VARCHAR, language VARCHAR, kind VARCHAR, qualname VARCHAR,"
    ...     " start_line INTEGER, end_line INTEGER, executable_lines INTEGER,"
    ...     " covered_lines INTEGER, coverage_ratio DOUBLE, tested BOOLEAN,"
    ...     " untested_reason VARCHAR, created_at TIMESTAMP)"
    ... )
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute(
    ...     "INSERT INTO core.goids VALUES ("
    ...     " 'urn:func', 'demo', 'abc', 'foo.py', 'python', 'function',"
    ...     " 'foo', 'h128', 1, 3)"
    ... )
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> con.execute(
    ...     "INSERT INTO analytics.coverage_lines VALUES "
    ...     " ('demo', 'abc', 'foo.py', 1, TRUE, TRUE),"
    ...     " ('demo', 'abc', 'foo.py', 2, TRUE, FALSE),"
    ...     " ('demo', 'abc', 'foo.py', 3, FALSE, FALSE)"
    ... )
    <duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection object ...>
    >>> cfg = CoverageAnalyticsConfig(repo="demo", commit="abc")
    >>> compute_coverage_functions(con, cfg)
    >>> con.execute(
    ...     "SELECT executable_lines, covered_lines, coverage_ratio, tested"
    ...     " FROM analytics.coverage_functions"
    ... ).fetchall()
    [(2, 1, 0.5, True)]

name: tests_analytics
docstring: Build test_coverage_edges from coverage contexts and test catalog.

name: TestCoverageConfig
docstring:
Configuration for deriving test coverage edges.

    Parameters
    ----------
    repo:
        Repository slug.
    commit:
        Commit SHA.
    repo_root:
        Path to the repository root containing the coverage file.
    coverage_file:
        Optional explicit path to a coverage.py database (defaults to repo_root/.coverage).

name: EdgeContext
docstring: Shared context for building test coverage edges.

name: FunctionRow
docstring: Minimal function metadata used for coverage edge construction.

name: _backfill_test_goids
docstring:
Try to map test_catalog entries to GOIDs and update catalog rows.

    Returns
    -------
    tuple[dict[str, int], dict[str, str]]
        Mappings from test_id to GOID h128 and URN.

name: backfill_test_goids_for_catalog
docstring:
Public wrapper to backfill GOIDs and URNs for tests in test_catalog.

    Returns
    -------
    tuple[dict[str, int], dict[str, str]]
        Mappings from test_id to GOID h128 and URN.

name: build_edges_for_file_for_tests
docstring:
Exposed wrapper around `_edges_for_file` for unit testing.

    Parameters
    ----------
    file_funcs:
        Functions within the file (dicts with GOID metadata).
    statements_set:
        Executable statement lines for the file.
    contexts_by_lineno:
        Mapping of line numbers to coverage contexts (pytest nodeids).
    rel_path:
        Repo-relative file path.
    ctx:
        EdgeContext holding repo metadata and test mappings.

    Returns
    -------
    list[tuple]
        Edge tuples mirroring analytics.test_coverage_edges schema.

name: _file_coverage
docstring:
Extract executable statements and contexts for a single file.

    Returns
    -------
    tuple[set[int], dict[int, set[str]]]
        Executable statement line numbers and context mappings.

name: compute_test_coverage_edges
docstring:
Populate analytics.test_coverage_edges by combining coverage contexts with GOIDs.

    This expects coverage.py to have been run with dynamic contexts enabled
    (e.g., dynamic_context = test_function) so contexts_by_lineno returns
    pytest nodeids.

name: __init__
docstring: Analytics utilities that turn ingestion outputs into hotspots and coverage reports.

name: main
docstring: CLI entrypoint for CodeIntel pipeline and document exports.

name: _setup_logging
docstring:
Configure logging based on -v/--verbose count.

    0 -> WARNING, 1 -> INFO, 2+ -> DEBUG.

name: _open_connection
docstring:
Open a DuckDB connection and ensure schemas/views exist for write mode.

    Parameters
    ----------
    cfg:
        CodeIntel configuration holding paths.
    read_only:
        Whether to open the database read-only.

    Returns
    -------
    duckdb.DuckDBPyConnection
        Live DuckDB connection.

name: _cmd_docs_export
docstring:
Export only, assuming the pipeline has already populated the DuckDB db.

    This is what `scripts/generate_documents.sh` should call:

        codeintel docs export --repo <slug> --commit <sha>

    Returns
    -------
    int
        Exit code (0 on success).

name: main
docstring:
CLI entrypoint for the CodeIntel pipeline and export commands.

    Parameters
    ----------
    argv:
        Optional argument list (defaults to sys.argv).

    Returns
    -------
    int
        Exit code (0 on success).

name: __init__
docstring: CLI entry points and helpers for running CodeIntel pipelines from the command line.

name: models
docstring: Typed MCP request/response models and error payloads.

name: ViewRow
docstring: Generic row wrapper for DuckDB view/table results.

name: __getitem__
docstring:
Allow dict-style access for compatibility with legacy code/tests.

        Parameters
        ----------
        key : str
            Field name to retrieve.

        Returns
        -------
        object
            Value for the requested field.

name: ProblemDetail
docstring: Problem Details payload for MCP error responses.

name: Message
docstring: Structured message attached to responses.

name: ResponseMeta
docstring: Response metadata including clamping and messaging.

name: FunctionSummaryResponse
docstring: Response wrapper for function summary lookups.

name: HighRiskFunctionsResponse
docstring: Response wrapper for high-risk function listings.

name: CallGraphNeighborsResponse
docstring: Incoming/outgoing call graph edges.

name: TestsForFunctionResponse
docstring: Tests that exercise a given function.

name: FileSummaryResponse
docstring: Summary of a file plus nested function rows.

name: DatasetDescriptor
docstring: Metadata describing a browseable dataset.

name: DatasetRowsResponse
docstring: Rows returned from a dataset slice.

name: config
docstring: MCP server configuration models and environment loading helpers.

name: McpServerConfig
docstring:
Configuration for the CodeIntel MCP server.

    This determines:
      - whether we talk directly to DuckDB (`local_db`) or a remote HTTP API
      - which repo/commit the server represents
      - safety limits for tool responses (to avoid flooding context windows)

name: _expand_paths
docstring:
Normalize repo_root and db_path to absolute paths early.

        Parameters
        ----------
        values : dict
            Raw values provided to the model.

        Returns
        -------
        dict
            Updated values with expanded path fields.

name: _check_backend
docstring:
Ensure db_path or api_base_url is present for the configured backend mode.

        Returns
        -------
        McpServerConfig
            Instance with inferred defaults applied.

        Raises
        ------
        ValueError
            If the mode is unsupported or remote_api is missing api_base_url.

name: from_env
docstring:
Build a server config from environment variables.

        Environment variables:
          - CODEINTEL_REPO_ROOT      (default: ".")
          - CODEINTEL_REPO           (default: basename(CODEINTEL_REPO_ROOT))
          - CODEINTEL_COMMIT         (default: "HEAD")
          - CODEINTEL_DB_PATH        (default: <repo_root>/build/db/codeintel.duckdb)
          - CODEINTEL_API_BASE_URL   (for remote_api mode)
          - CODEINTEL_MCP_MODE       ("local_db" | "remote_api", default "local_db")
          - CODEINTEL_MCP_DEFAULT_LIMIT (int, default 50)
          - CODEINTEL_MCP_MAX_ROWS      (int, default 200)
          - CODEINTEL_MCP_TIMEOUT_SEC   (float, default 10.0)

        Returns
        -------
        McpServerConfig
            Configuration assembled from environment values.

name: registry
docstring: MCP tool registration and error-to-problem mapping.

name: _wrap
docstring:
Wrap a backend-facing tool to normalize McpError into ProblemDetail payloads.

    Returns
    -------
    Callable[..., object]
        Wrapped tool function that emits dict payloads.

name: register_tools
docstring: Register all MCP tools on the given FastMCP instance.

name: tools
docstring: Re-export MCP server configuration for CLI tooling.

name: backend
docstring: Backend implementations for MCP tools over DuckDB or HTTP.

name: ClampResult
docstring: Result of clamping limit/offset values with messaging.

name: _clamp_limit_value
docstring:
Clamp a requested limit to safe bounds, returning warnings instead of errors.

    Returns
    -------
    ClampResult
        Applied limit plus any informational/warning/error messages for callers.

name: _clamp_offset_value
docstring:
Clamp an offset to a non-negative value, returning messaging instead of raising.

    Returns
    -------
    ClampResult
        Applied offset plus any informational/warning/error messages for callers.

name: _column_exists
docstring:
Return True when a table or view exposes the given column.

    Returns
    -------
    bool
        True if the column exists, otherwise False.

name: _fetch_one_dict
docstring:
Execute a parameterized query and return the first row as a dict.

    Parameters
    ----------
    cur:
        DuckDB connection or relation supporting `execute`.
    sql:
        SQL string with parameter placeholders.
    params:
        Parameters to bind to the query.

    Returns
    -------
    dict[str, object] | None
        Row dictionary if present, otherwise None.

name: _fetch_all_dicts
docstring:
Execute a parameterized query and return all rows as dictionaries.

    Parameters
    ----------
    cur:
        DuckDB connection or relation supporting `execute`.
    sql:
        SQL string with parameter placeholders.
    params:
        Parameters to bind to the query.

    Returns
    -------
    list[dict[str, object]]
        List of row dictionaries.

name: QueryBackend
docstring: Abstract interface consumed by MCP tools.

name: get_function_summary
docstring: Return a function summary from docs.v_function_summary.

name: list_high_risk_functions
docstring: List high-risk functions from analytics.goid_risk_factors.

name: get_callgraph_neighbors
docstring: Return incoming/outgoing call graph neighbors.

name: get_tests_for_function
docstring: List tests that exercised a function.

name: get_file_summary
docstring: Return file summary plus function rows.

name: list_datasets
docstring: List datasets available to browse.

name: read_dataset_rows
docstring: Read rows from a dataset in small slices.

name: DuckDBBackend
docstring:
DuckDB-backed implementation of QueryBackend.

    Assumes a single repo/commit per DuckDB file, but repo/commit filters
    are still applied for future multi-repo support.

name: __post_init__
docstring: Populate default dataset table mapping if one is not provided.

name: _resolve_function_goid
docstring:
Resolve a function to its GOID using docs.v_function_summary.

        Returns
        -------
        int | None
            GOID hash if found, otherwise None.

        Raises
        ------
        errors.backend_failure
            If the retrieved GOID has an unexpected type.

name: get_function_summary
docstring:
Fetch a single row from docs.v_function_summary.

        Returns
        -------
        RowDict | None
            Function summary if found, otherwise None.

        Raises
        ------
        errors.McpError
            If insufficient identifiers are provided (invalid_argument).

        Returns
        -------
        FunctionSummaryResponse
            Wrapped function summary payload.

name: list_high_risk_functions
docstring:
Query analytics.goid_risk_factors for high-risk functions.

        Returns
        -------
        HighRiskFunctionsResponse
            High-risk function rows sorted by risk_score plus metadata.

name: get_callgraph_neighbors
docstring:
Return incoming/outgoing edges from docs.v_call_graph_enriched.

        Returns
        -------
        dict[str, list[RowDict]]
            Mapping with "outgoing" and "incoming" edge lists.

        Raises
        ------
        errors.invalid_argument
            If direction is not one of {'in','out','both'}.

name: get_tests_for_function
docstring:
Query docs.v_test_to_function for tests that hit a given function.

        Parameters
        ----------
        goid_h128:
            GOID hash of the function under test.
        urn:
            URN of the function under test when the GOID is unknown.
        limit:
            Maximum number of rows to return (clamped to MAX_ROWS_LIMIT when unset).

        Returns
        -------
        TestsForFunctionResponse
            Wrapped test rows.

        Raises
        ------
        errors.invalid_argument
            Raised when identifiers are missing.

name: get_file_summary
docstring:
Return docs.v_file_summary row plus function summaries for a file.

        Returns
        -------
        RowDict | None
            File summary with nested functions, or None if missing.

name: list_datasets
docstring:
List datasets that can be browsed via MCP tools.

        Returns
        -------
        list[dict[str, object]]
            Dataset metadata entries.

name: read_dataset_rows
docstring:
Read a slice of a dataset using DuckDB's relational API.

        Raises
        ------
        errors.invalid_argument
            Raised when dataset_name is unknown or when `limit` exceeds the
            allowed maximum.

        Returns
        -------
        DatasetRowsResponse
            Dataset slice payload with applied limits and offset.

name: __main__
docstring: Entry point for running the MCP server as a module.

name: errors
docstring: MCP error taxonomy and helpers for Problem Details responses.

name: McpError
docstring: Base MCP error carrying a ProblemDetail payload.

name: __str__
docstring:
Return a concise string for logging/diagnostics.

        Returns
        -------
        str
            Concise representation of the problem.

name: invalid_argument
docstring:
Construct an invalid-argument problem.

    Returns
    -------
    McpError
        Error wrapping a ProblemDetail payload.

name: not_found
docstring:
Construct a not-found problem.

    Returns
    -------
    McpError
        Error wrapping a ProblemDetail payload.

name: backend_failure
docstring:
Construct a backend-failure problem.

    Returns
    -------
    McpError
        Error wrapping a ProblemDetail payload.

name: server
docstring: MCP server exposing CodeIntel datasets and tools.

name: main
__init__
docstring: Model Context Protocol (MCP) adapters exposing CodeIntel datasets over the tooling bridge.
